data: Assess level of Nicotine dependence and review guidelines
Pregnant or lactating patients need to have risks / benefits explained. Nicotine gum or inhaler recommended on a PRN basis. Patch, if used, should be removed at night
If/when Nicotine Replacement Therapy is initiated, then remind patient to stop smoking or reduce smoking (as applicable)
Low Nicotine Dependence: less than 10 cigarettes/day OR a score of 0 to 2 points based on brief Fagerstrom test
1 patch, topical, qdaily, drug form: patch
2 mg, buccal, q1h, PRN nicotine withdrawal, drug form: gum
2 mg, buccal, q1h, PRN nicotine withdrawal, drug form: lozenge
1 each, inhalation, once, drug form: device
1 cartridge, inhalation, q1h, PRN nicotine withdrawal, drug form: cart
Moderate Nicotine Dependence: less than 10 cigarettes/day OR a score of 3 to 4 points based on brief Fagerstrom test
1 patch, topical, qdaily, drug form: patch
2 mg, buccal, q1h, PRN nicotine withdrawal, drug form: gum
2 mg, buccal, q1h, PRN nicotine withdrawal, drug form: lozenge
1 each, inhalation, once, drug form: device
1 cartridge, inhalation, q1h, PRN nicotine withdrawal, drug form: cart
High Nicotine Dependence: 10 or more cigarettes/day OR a score of 5 to 6 points based on brief Fagerstrom test
1 patch, topical, qdaily, drug form: patch
4 mg, buccal, q1h, PRN nicotine withdrawal, drug form: gum
4 mg, buccal, q1h, PRN nicotine withdrawal, drug form: lozenge
1 each, inhalation, once, drug form: device
1 cartridge, inhalation, q1h, PRN nicotine withdrawal, drug form: cart
Monitor and assess closely for nicotine withdrawal symptoms, continued smoking or adverse effects
Notify physician / nurse practitioner / pharmacist if further increase in NRT is required
